channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Mon, 14 Oct 2024 23:54:18 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: JD Vance: Trump appeals to Black and Latino voters by 'listening, not lecturing', unlike Kamala Harris
item.description: As the US presidential elections approach, Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are focusing on Latino and Black voters. Harris introduced a plan to empower Black men, aiming for financial freedom and lower costs. Polls show Latina women favor Harris while Latino men are divided, with some viewing Trump positively for listening to voters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Meghan Markle was paranoid, always followed by drones, vehicles'
item.description: Meghan Markle's former bodyguard said he once allowed Meghan to grocery shopping because she said that's what she wanted. "I pushed the cart around the grocery store, and she was putting stuff in it. She really enjoyed that," Davies said adding that he felt sorry for Meghan when she got married to Prince Harry and became a part of the Royal Family.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Don and Kamala taunt each others mental fitness
item.description: MAGA Republican Trump and Democratic candidate Harris escalated their verbal attacks, challenging each other's mental fitness while avoiding direct confrontational interviews. Trump refused to release full medical records, while Harris maintained her physical fitness. Trump's criticisms extend to a controversial biopic, fueling tensions ahead of the November election.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: 'Trump doesn’t care about anyone but himself’: Supporters left stranded in 93°F heat after rally
item.description: Supporters were left stranded for hours in 93°F heat after a Donald Trump rally in Coachella Valley. The event faced multiple issues, including a suspected assassination attempt and inadequate transportation arrangements. Despite Trump's claim of 100,000 attendees, the permit allowed only 15,000.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Movie director accuses Elon Musk of copying designs for Tesla’s new prototypes from 'I, Robot'
item.description: Tesla's unveiling of new designs at the 'We, Robot' event led to controversy as 'I, Robot' director Alex Proyas accused Elon Musk of copying film designs. Proyas highlighted similarities between Tesla's prototypes and his movie's tech, igniting speculation and impacting Tesla's stock.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump says he had a great relationship with Ivana; The Apprentice movie shows 'rape'
item.description: USA Today reported that there is a stomach-churning scene in the movie where Donald tells Ivana that he's no longer attracted to her. Ivana retorts that Donald is fat and balding. "Donald throws Ivana to the floor and climbs on top of her, proceeding to sexually assault his wife as she screams for him to stop," the report said. Trump slammed the movie and said it is a fake and classless movie written about him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump campaign accuses Kamala Harris of wanting to 'cancel American traditions' on Columbus Day
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris, during an Indigenous Peoples' Day speech, urged reflection on America's colonial history, highlighting European explorers' impact on native communities. Republican senator JD Vance and the Trump campaign criticized Harris for allegedly trying to 'cancel' American traditions by supporting Indigenous Peoples' Day over Columbus Day, while claiming Trump honors Christopher Columbus' legacy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Frontier Airlines passenger forgets phone in airport, wants pilot to turn plane back: 'I own 7 continents'
item.description: A woman on a Frontier Airlines flight from San Diego to Las Vegas threw a bizarre tantrum, claiming to own seven continents and demanding the plane turn back as she had forgotten her phone at the airport. Her outburst, which included controversial remarks, was captured by fellow passengers and went viral on TikTok.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bill Maher says he will do this if Donald Trump wins but he's certain about Harris' victory
item.description: ​"And that's why this is a great country. Because as crazy as he (Donald Trump) is, he didn't do anything about it (Bill Maher's jokes) the first time. So I'm not just gonna lose my nervous system about now. He could, he's insane. So he could like start sending people to Guantanamo Bay. I didn't put anything past this guy. He thinks they are eating cats and dogs. But am I going to worry about it?" Bill Maher said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Is this you': Vivek Ramaswamy under fire for photo with Vem Miller
item.description: ​As Vivek praised Elon Musk's SpaceX achievement and compared Musk with Benjamin Franklin, social media users posted Vivek's photo with Vem Miller and said it's wild that Vivek said this is a 1776 moment but he's acquainted with "Donald Trump's apparent attempted assassin Vem Miller". "What did you know and when did you know it," one asked Vivek Ramaswamy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Petty, partisan, un-American': Social media on Harris-Biden not congratulating Elon Musk on SpaceX feat
item.description: Elon Musk had a clash with California as it rejected Elon Musk' request for more frequent SpaceX launches from the state's central coast and it cited Elon Musk's politics as the reason for the rejection. The California Coastal Commission on Thursday voted 6-4 against the US Space Force's request to allow SpaceX to increase the number of launches of its Falcon 9 rocket at Vandenberg Space Force Base from 36 to 50 a year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump asks Harris to pass cognitive stamina test amid row over medical report: 'Slow and lethargic'
item.description: Instead of releasing his medical records, Donald Trump questioned Kamala Harris' cognitive stamina and agility and said something is very wrong with her as she is slow and lethargic in answering even the easiest of questions. Trump's post came as Kamala Harris released her medical report in which she has been declared fit for the role of the president.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan to repay over $30 billion debt in FY25, says central bank
item.description: Pakistan is set to repay USD 30.35 billion in foreign debt and interest from August 2024 to July 2025, significantly higher than the previous year's repayments. The country’s foreign debt-to-GDP ratio has decreased, but the rising repayments highlight the need for strategies to boost foreign income and reduce expenditures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump calls Chinese President Xi 'brilliant,' says US faces greater threats from 'enemies within'
item.description: Donald Trump renewed praise for Chinese President Xi Jinping, calling him 'fierce' and 'smart.' Despite historical US-China trade tensions, Trump described their relationship as strong. The ex-president's affinity for authoritarian leaders also includes Vladimir Putin, with whom he reportedly had secret discussions, stirring debates about his foreign diplomacy and potential risks to US interests.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: '100% Trump supporter': Man arrested with loaded guns near Coachella rally denies assassination intent
item.description: An armed man, Vem Miller, was arrested near Trump's Coachella rally but denies assassination intentions, claiming to be a Trump supporter. He asserts that the firearms were for personal protection due to past threats. Fake IDs found with him were explained as legitimate documents for safety reasons.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Climber Sandy Irvine’s remains found on Mount Everest after 100 years
item.description: A National Geographic team discovers a preserved boot with Andrew Irvine's name on it, providing significant evidence in solving the nearly 100-year-old mystery of Irvine and Mallory's ill-fated 1924 Everest expedition. This may offer closure to Irvine's family and new insights into early Everest exploration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Will US have peaceful elections? Trump warns of 'very bad, sick people'
item.description: Former President Donald Trump suggested the potential need for military intervention on Election Day to address internal threats. He dismissed concerns about unrest from his supporters but highlighted worries about 'radical left lunatics' and external agitators, suggesting the National Guard or military might be necessary.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's sisters shifted to Jhelum jail on judicial remand
item.description: Aleema and Uzma Khan, sisters of ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan, are moved to Jhelum Jail after an anti-terrorism court denies extended physical remand in a high-security environment. The court schedules a bail hearing for October 19, questioning police procedural conduct and the necessity of further evidence collection.

item.title: 'Defend this holy land': Hezbollah airs audio recording of leader Hassan Nasrallah after his death
item.description: Hezbollah released an audio recording of its slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, urging fighters to defend Lebanon, following his death by an Israeli air strike. Amid escalating tensions, a drone attack injured 20 in Israel, and the US is sending an anti-missile system to support Israel. The UAE launched an aid campaign for Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I am concerned about...': James Clyburn on Black men supporting Trump in 2024 elections
item.description: United States Representative James Clyburn raises alarms over potential Black male voter apathy or support for Donald Trump, echoing former President Barack Obama's call to action. While Clyburn campaigns for Kamala Harris, addressing this demographic’s concerns remains a priority for Democrats.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
